Title: Cosa Sabrosa
Address: 2070 W Stadium Blvd, Ann Arbor, MI 48103

summary.snippet: "Great food, nice people, and live music from jazz, classic rock, motown."
"I’ve had the lamb, cauliflower, and chicken tacos, the nachos, queso, and."
"Super friendly service and the online ordering couldn’t have been easier."

most_relevant.description: Jeff and his amazing team put together a fantastic dinner buffet for our anniversary party! The food was so fresh and delicious, they arrived on time and people raved about the meal! Highly recommend them!

Kudos to the talented chefs behind the scenes for crafting the finest tacos in Ann Arbor. One suggestion: consider doubling up on the tortillas, as they tend to fall apart easily. We appreciated the grilled tortillas, as most places use them right out of the package without warming them up. The delicious guac, along with the flavorful elote and pickled veggies, was also a hit. The churros were also enjoyable. Although the horchata was tasty, it was sweeter than anticipated. We will certainly be back. Do keep in mind that the prices are higher than most places in town.

If you’re looking for the best dinner in AA, look no farther. It’s an 11/10 experience every single time and I make all of my friends go here. If you like birria, all of their options are amazing and I highly recommend the birria burrito! I was having a terrible day so I rewarded myself with one tonight and nearly cried tears of joy when I saw that they threw in some donuts with my order too. Cosa Sabrosa has my heart and deserves all of the good in the world <3

Customer service good . Food is tasteless . No seasoning . Had birria  tacos and quesadilla .OMG never again .  Disgusting . Just got it and it’s going straight to the trash . Order was under Osborne .

This is the best Latin food outside of a cookout you will find in Ann arbor. I mean that from the bottom of my heart. Not only is it amazing but it is consistent the first day me and my wife got it. We had to go back the next day. And it was just as good. They have great vegetarian options and the staff is super friendly. I also love the periodical music that's live in the next room. Whether to go or in-house with a beer, you cannot go wrong. I've lived here my whole life and I've never tasted Latin food this good. Why are you still reading this? You should be ordering online right now. Go trust me. Thank me later

Me and my bf tried this place and by the end we were falling into food comas. We couldn’t handle anymore sensory experiences😂 The food was THAT damn good. The kind of meal you might shed a tear for. Seriously god bless this place. The only sad thing is it’s kind of hidden and they deserve so much more business. They could easily be poppin as a walk in restaurant in down
town AA 👏👏👏

The menu here is simple but everything I have ever ordered is delicious and prepared with exceptional care. The birria tacos are amazing!
I usually get takeout but in summertime there are seats outside. Indoor seating is at the  Zal Gaz Grotto bar where you can also order drinks. On some nights there is live music next door.
This my go to place for carry out Mexican food.

Extraordinary. Never before have I consumed such excellence.

The experience is unconventional. Be prepared for an isolated ordering interface bereft of any person-on-person interaction. Be ready for the partially-smooth iPad user interface. Be ready for the unattached dining which seems to only be offered outside. Be ready for an unpredictable wait time. However, if you’re not a complete utter intolerant imbecile, you’ll sacrifice a bit of convenience for the absolute paradise of food which awaits. We ordered a plethora of items: the Elote, Birria Quesadilla, Steak Tacos, Beans, Rice and to finish it all off, Churros. I’m going to spare the reader the details but what words I have for each item could fill multiple pages. An eatery of elation.

I implore you to check it out. To miss out on such deliciousness would be criminal.
